Articles.Content: Glad to hear, she's my favourite ship.

Well, the RIE Corp engineering teams have finally completed the two commisioned corvettes, the RIE Siren-Class Minelayer Corvette, it's capable of deploying six RIE Mk 82 EDNM (Exoatmospheric Directional Naval Mines), and is protected generally by fighters. Then we have the RIE Kerbashev Type II Exploration and Relay Corvette, as well as the Type I. The Kerbashevs are two different ways of doing the same thing. Both are nearly identical, though the Type II is recommended. Due to the tedious and boring nature of relaying interplanetary communications, we thought it best to give it to either a): Those two unlucky sods over ther, or : A totally stable AI named HAL we found floating in space. Both can deploy twin relay boosters to give a relay station to the corvettes. Have some logistical fun boys.

Edited October 10, 2014 by Red, the Engineer

Well, the RIE Corp engineering teams have finally completed the two commisioned corvettes, the RIE Siren-Class Minelayer Corvette, it's capable of deploying six RIE Mk 82 EDNM (Exoatmospheric Directional Naval Mines), and is protected generally by fighters. Then we have the RIE Kerbashev Type II Exploration and Relay Corvette, as well as the Type I. The Kerbashevs are two different ways of doing the same thing. Both are nearly identical, though the Type II is recommended. Due to the tedious and boring nature of relaying interplanetary communications, we thought it best to give it to either a): Those two unlucky sods over ther, or : A totally stable AI named HAL we found floating in space. Both can deploy twin relay boosters to give a relay station to the corvettes. Have some logistical fun boys.

Looks cool, six RIE Mk82 EDNM's ? mines are useless in a 3 dimensional area of operation even moving homing mines. But I like the logistics idea, it opens up a new train of thought. Credit to you.

Looks cool, six RIE Mk82 EDNM's ? mines are useless in a 3 dimensional area of operation even moving homing mines. But I like the logistics idea, it opens up a new train of thought. Credit to you.

Ah, but my idea is is that when you get close to the mines, the mine shifts position to target your craft and deploys twin mk82 bombs. I may update them to fire the new space missiles in BDArmory. Like a sentry turret.
Can someone tell me how well I managed?

Its official

The Dorchester Class is now finished.

Front view

Angled View

Side View

Hanger Bay

For the most part my craft are fixed and ready to go for .25 but Im going to run some more test, show off a few new things and make my craft as user friendly before I repost everything
Alright, can anyone tell me how to post pictures?

Alright, can anyone tell me how to post pictures?

Set up an Imgur.com account

then after uploading the pictures copy the picture, then click on the picture icon on the tool bar just about where you type your comment on the KSP forums, paste the pic and you should be good.

Another Craft I have been working one lately is a stealth bomber.

I have found the most affective weapon for it is 8 cluster bombs from BD armory

Bombing Run Pics

I still haven't thought of a name for it so I ll let y'all help me out

Rules are it has to be biblical, spiritual, or inspiring (think Merica for inspiring)

Edited October 10, 2014 by War Eagle 1

'Right, I still have some touch ups to do (RCS Blocks, extra batteries, rockets that fire without destroying my own craft) but here's the RIE Kerbashev Type III ICI (Indirect Combat Intervention) Corvette. As usual, the ICI series of the Kerbashev will have a manned and unmanned version.

Edited October 10, 2014 by Red, the Engineer
Just wondering if a "Dreadnaught Class" could be added for Capital ships (With use of BD armory) and if we can use B-9 V5

Just wondering if a "Dreadnaught Class" could be added for Capital ships (With use of BD armory) and if we can use B-9 V5

Capital ship describes any large military space-going ship, including dreadnaughts (I'm afraid you can't use BD Armoury with them). B9 is not allowed - please check the guidelines in future.
Alright, all testing is now complete on my 0.24 in-space warships, and all seem to port over into 0.25 quite nicely.
Most of them will, when parts are removed in .26 we could start having problems.

Most of them will, when parts are removed in .26 we could start having problems.

Which parts? I only see the wings being swapped for the new SP+ ones, and those aren't out of place on my warships (thank goodness).

The only parts that I've heard might be getting swapped in 0.26 is the MK3 ones, and those aren't used in any of my stuff.
I know, but most if not all stock craft should've moved to .25 without problems. No parts have been removed yet.

So, I've been working on trying to make a jet fighter using the new plane parts...

So far, it's produced a small VTOL and a fast single-engine fighter with bomb bay.

So, I've been working on trying to make a jet fighter using the new plane parts...

So far, it's produced a small VTOL and a fast single-engine fighter with bomb bay.

http://i.imgur.com/Z0XECII.png

http://i.imgur.com/TIhFxhB.png

The single seater

Multirole or Attacker?

The single seater

Multirole or Attacker?

The single-seater is sort of multi-role in that it does have plenty of room for warheads on the wings, as well as the small bomb bay in the center fuselage. The fighter is STOL due to great balancing, and it does have a cool ejection system as well.

However, I'm still not sure if I want to convert that VTOL into a fighter...

The single-seater is sort of multi-role in that it does have plenty of room for warheads on the wings, as well as the small bomb bay in the center fuselage. The fighter is STOL due to great balancing, and it does have a cool ejection system as well.

However, I'm still not sure if I want to convert that VTOL into a fighter...

Id make it a fighter/bomber like the Su-34

Id make it a fighter/bomber like the Su-34

The Su-34 is a two seater, in fact there are very little single seat fighter bombers. (cant think of any off the top of my head).

The Su-34 is a two seater, in fact there are very little single seat fighter bombers. (cant think of any off the top of my head).

J-10, F/A-18E, Rafale, F-2, JAS-39, AV-8B, F-35 (How could you forget this one?).

Edited October 12, 2014 by War Eagle 1

1. J-10: that is not classified as a fighter-bomber, it is a multirole fighter design much like the F-16.

2.F/A-18: twin-engined carrier aircraft, again multirole supersonic aircraft, not a fighter-bomber.

3. AV-8B: single-engined VTOL operated from small to mini aircraft carriers or helicarriers, again multirole without focus on ground attack

4. F-35: single-engined multirole 5th generation supersonic overpriced trash(no wonder I forgot it).

Fighter-bombers have the following characteristics: twin-engines for added weight carrying capability, a pilot and WSO(weapons station operator), inbuilt terrain following radar function, inbuilt laser designating unit with electro-optical devices, also has added provisions for jammers and EW suites, such as the wing-tip pylons on the Su-34 being able to carry massive SAP-518, and SAP-14 jammers.

Edit:

1. Rafale: multirole supersonic single seat fighter, again not meant specifically for air to ground.

2. F-2 : multirole fighter, not meant for ground attack.
